content: Homepage of Wim Michiels Homepage of Wim Michiels Who am I I am a full professor at KU Leuven and a member of the Numerical Analysis and Applied Mathematics (NUMA) Section. Chapter on "Theory of control of linear time-delay systems" in the forthcoming Encyclopedia of Systems and Control PhD course at the Gran Sasso Science Institute, L'Aquila, May 2025 Phd course on Analysis and Design Methods for Time-Delay Systems, organized by the European Embedded Control Institute (EECI) , Paris, March 2025 New project "Time-scale aware analysis and control of hybrid networked systems" funded by the Global PhD Partnerships program of KU Leuven, with Laurentiu Hetel. Research Research interests: Dynamical systems (Numerical) linear algebra Scientific computing Control: theory, applications, and numerical tools. In particular, control of large-scale systems Described by functional differential equations (delay/neutral) Described by partial differential equations Systems with a network structure Stability analysis and stabilization, robust and optimal control, control oriented model order reduction Optimization: algorithms, and control applications Current research team Victor Janssens Evert Provoost Sanaz Akbarisisi Adrian Saldanha Diego Torres Garcia Jasper Visterin Pournami Padmalatha Publications and software A regularly updated list of accepted and published papers (with links for download ) can be found by clicking on this link.
